name: 500EXT Extender
description: A 500-series extender like the 500EXT will make testing and troubleshooting easier.

name: Desoldering Pump
description: If you accidentally solder something in the wrong place, a desoldering pump can save the day.

name: Flat Head Screwdriver
description: A small flat head screwdriver for adjusting a trimpot.

name: Multi-meter
description: If you run into problems, a multimeter can come in handy. You can also use it to sort resistors.

name: Needle-nose Pliers
description: Small pliers for bending and crimping.

name: Resistor Calculator
description: Resistor sorting made easy! Enter a value to find the color bands, or enter your color bands to find the resistor's value. Type in the value of the resistor you need and this tool will show you the corresponding color code.

name: Room EQ Wizard (REW)
description: REW is an incredible piece of free measurement software for PC, Mac, and Linux. While REW is primarily known for measuring room acoustics, it's also a powerful tool for measuring analog gear. Download and install the latest version at the Room EQ Wizard website.

name: Solder
description: You can use tin solder or lead-free. We recommend tin because it is easier and more forgiving to use.

name: Soldering Iron
description: We recommend an adjustable-temperature station. The smaller, pencil-style ones that plug directly into the wall do not have enough power to create good joints consistently.

name: Tape
description: A bit of clear tape will help hold some tricky components in place for soldering.

name: Wire Cutters
description: A good pair will be sharp and have a fine point for cutting leads down right at the solder joint. Don't use a set of large cutters meant for household wiring.
